episode.description: This time, we will focus on the living art of Bonsai. What is behind the art of cultivating trees into aesthetically pleasing shapes in containers rather than allowing nature to take its course?
episode.subtitle: Bonsai: Nature in a Pot
episode.title: Spiritual Explorers

episode.description: Animism, deities are present in every aspect of nature, lives on today in Kumano, Why does nature continue to play such an important role in Japanese spirituality? We visit a trio of revered shrines.
episode.subtitle: Kumano: Deities of Nature
episode.title: Spiritual Explorers

episode.description: Mikawa in central Japan. Fireworks have long held a special significance in this region. Mikawa's traditional Tezutsu fireworks are held as an offering to its own tutelary deity who protects the land.
episode.subtitle: Mikawa's Tezutsu Fireworks
episode.title: Spiritual Explorers

episode.description: Since ancient times, yamabushi, or ascetic mountain priests, were believed to have supernatural powers. Our explorers seek to understand the spirituality of yamabushi by undergoing ascetic training.
episode.subtitle: Yamabushi: The Mountain Priests of Japan
episode.title: Spiritual Explorers
